newsitem.title: SWEDEN: TENNIS-SWISS TAKE DAVIS CUP LEAD OVER SWEDES.
newsitem.headline: TENNIS-SWISS TAKE DAVIS CUP LEAD OVER SWEDES.

text.p: Swiss number one Marc Rosset won a marathon over Swede Magnus Larsson to give his country a 1-0 lead over in their Davis Cup world group first-round tie on Friday.
Rosset, 26, outfought Larsson 7-6 3-6 6-4 4-6 13-11 on the slow plexi-pave surface at Lulea's Pontus Hall near the Arctic circle, probably the most northerly location for a Davis Cup match.

The lanky, faired-haired Swiss, world ranked 24th, took the first set in a tie-break. But the 26-year-old Larsson held his own throughout the marathon three hours and 52 minutes of play which only saw four breaks of serve.
Rosset spearheads the Swiss team and because of his strong and precise serve is considered the only real competition to the favoured Swedes.
Although Larsson, ranked 46th, also served well and played more imaginatively when both players were visibly exhausted, Rosset's serves were unfaltering.
Rosset, in bright orange shoes, eventually broke Larsson's serve in a 24-game final set to take the match.
"I played as well as I could," Larsson said. "He serves well and is a tough competitor."
"It was a pretty good start wearing him out for the weekend but it's the win that counts."
